thread.title: 'We will rebuild': Storm Doris batters UK - how the internet reacted
thread.title_full: 'We will rebuild': Storm Doris batters UK - how the internet reacted

author: Mark Molloy
title: 'We will rebuild': Storm Doris batters UK - how the internet reacted
text:
'We will rebuild': Storm Doris batters UK - how the internet reacted Storm Doris: How the internet reacted Credit: Twitter Mark Molloy  55pm 
A Storm Doris ‚Äòweather bomb‚Äô bringing 100mph gusts and blizzard-like snow has wreaked havoc across the UK ‚Äì here‚Äôs how the internet reacted . 
It appears the British really do love talking about the weather; with travel chaos complaints, striking photos and jokes making up much of the Twitter reaction to the storm. Storm Doris hits UK: in pictures Some weather watchers just couldn't get over the name Doris Of course this British storm is called Doris! The next one will be called Edna so they can go for tea & cake together. ‚Äî Rob Houchen (@robhouchen) February 23, 2017 As #stormdoris hits the UK, this is how they are named. Also, these are the names that weren't allowed... https://t.co/2tuiTqWIAo pic.twitter.com/qU08LxcC8u ‚Äî Dave the Goat (@thecasefarm) February 23, 2017 Was expecting storm Doris to be abit on the feeble side from the name, I was wrong. Fair play Doris you old hag. #Weather #stormdoris ‚Äî Eamon Mcnutt (@Eamando1) February 23, 2017 I love that the storm is called Doris. It makes me think of an angry Grandma! üòÇ #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/xN1a5hzcHG ‚Äî Holly Atterton (@RealHollyA) February 23, 2017 Others had some questions ‚Äî Brian Smith (@TheRealBrianSmi) February 23, 2017 Why, whenever there's a storm do the news send a reporter to stand at a windy seafront? Would we not believe it otherwise? #stormdoris ‚Äî Tony Shepherd (@tonysheps) February 23, 2017 News reporters were out in force to cover the storm Sky News already has a reporter on a windswept beach. #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/eKF6zideuz ‚Äî Emily @ JF Recruit (@emilylindwelch) February 23, 2017 I hope this weather reporter got a big bonus for doing the weather today #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/OJPRzmhEl7 ‚Äî Katy Metcalfe (@KatyMet) February 23, 2017 I want to see a news reporter with a bag on their face like this again #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/OYEYTYLmQt ‚Äî Jamie (@JFelms) February 23, 2017 A few nearly got blown away Lashing rain and vicious winds of around 70mph here on the sea front in Rhyl with stormy seas. Hard to stand. #StormDoris pic.twitter.com/AiolrjXAYJ ‚Äî Liam Dutton (@liamdutton) February 23, 2017 Watch | Reporter blown about by Storm Doris in Blackpool 01:27 ‚Äî Scott Smith (@scott_smith9) February 23, 2017 We shall not be defeated by you Doris. We will rebuild #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/CIHfRA6xYL Others shared videos of the storm #StormDoris is literally blowing people off their feet in Merseyside pic.twitter.com/PElL7Hkfwc ‚Äî Philip Pickering ‚û∞ (@philip_pbm339) February 22, 2017 Best of luck using an umbrella out in Liverpool today... #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/uRsNquCmY8 ‚Äî Harry Newbury (@HarryNewbury) February 23, 2017 Storm Doris making things difficult at bird feeder #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/kI7hL47P2v ‚Äî 365 Days of Nature (@365_nature) February 23, 2017 Water defies gravity in Aberystwyth #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/zjLvLJ8WyC ‚Äî Ben Birchall (@BenBirchallUK) February 23, 2017 Free foam party on Cleveleys promenade today. #stormdoris pic.twitter.com/KdBfinR1tJ ‚Äî Cleveleys News (@cleveleysnews) February 23, 2017 And some striking images too... ‚Äî Mike Pattinson (@MikePattinson) February 23, 2017 #StormDoris has reached nearly 90mph on its way to batter Britain, causing flight cancellations and commuter chaos https://t.co/KqFQMSBR7D pic.twitter.com/Q8ipZ4WleR ‚Äî The Telegraph (@Telegraph) February 23, 2017 Take care in the snow today. #StormDoris pic.twitter.com/zj7kMjV7MR ‚Äî Clarence House (@ClarenceHouse) February 23, 2017 View #StormDoris from space with this satellite image showing her moving eastwards across the UK pic.twitter.com/Oa3ELPaMBj ‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) February 23, 2017 #StormDoris is now bringing wind gusts of 72 mph across Aberdaron (W Wales) pic.twitter.com/AML4WeigKk ‚Äî Met Office (@metoffice) February 23, 2017 My morning so fars. Thanks #stormdoris üñïüèºüñïüèºüñïüèº pic.twitter.com/AFasU4PxDm ‚Äî Peaches Fitness (@peachesfit) February 23, 2017 There were a few jokes ... Strong Gails out this morning, mind yourselves! ‚Äî Alex Byrne (@Albyrne12Alex) February 23, 2017 #Stormdoris causing problems across the network. This is the scene from #Brighton station this morning pic.twitter.com/htFclHfMeQ
